channel.title: Help
channel.description:
I am wondering whats the difference between a Graphic Card and a Video Card..
Also can someone suggest whatever i need may it be gc or vc from here: www.futureshop.ca
I am under a tight budget-$120..
And this is to play unreal tournament, i cant really play any games because i think my brother took out the gc or vc when he gave me this computer.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:2, topic:54283”]There is no difference between a video card and a graphic card. They are just two different names for the same thing. [br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2007, 11:05:01 PM[/size][hr]Check this out, although I only took a quick look: http://www.futureshop.ca/catalog/proddetail.asp?logon=&langid=EN&sku_id=0665000FS10052562&catid=10524

Thats a pretty good card afaik. Only 99 bucks…[/quote]
Heh, I’m getting a Radeon 9550 for 47.99 on newegg.

They’re pretty close though.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Thats your network adapter.

I am pretty sure your graphics are onboard. If you ever wanna play a game with decent graphics you should buy a card.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I dont know what i have…my brother gave me this computer because hes building a new one all i know is…

AMD athlon™64 processor
3000+
1.79gh, 1.43GB ram
Graphic card i think is:Realtek RTL8139/810x Family Fast Ethernet NIC

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

$120 for a video card isnt a tight budget >_>

if you have a PCIe mother board, id say go with the 6600GT
if you have AGP, well, i dono anything about the ati breed and i certainly wouldnt suggest a 5500
and iiiiiiiffffffffffff you just have PCI, you unlucky guy, i have felt your pain

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

There is no difference between a video card and a graphic card. They are just two different names for the same thing. [br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2007, 11:05:01 PM[/size][hr]Check this out, although I only took a quick look: http://www.futureshop.ca/catalog/proddetail.asp?logon=&langid=EN&sku_id=0665000FS10052562&catid=10524

Thats a pretty good card afaik. Only 99 bucks…

Read full topic
